ca.sandstorm.luminance.gui
Class GUIManager

java.lang.Object
  ca.sandstorm.luminance.gui.GUIManager

public class GUIManager
extends java.lang.Object

Class for handling buttons and whether they have been tapped.

Author:
Kumaran Vijayan

Field Detail

MAX_WIDGET_COUNT

public static int MAX_WIDGET_COUNT
Constructor Detail

GUIManager

public GUIManager(boolean isFading)
Constructor. By default, the number of buttons to be managed is 0.

Parameters:
isFading - Set to true if the background is to be faded when the GUI is being drawn. Generally used for something like the pause menu.
Method Detail

getIsEnabled

public boolean getIsEnabled()
Return the boolean specifying whether this GUIManager should check to see if Buttons are being clicked. If false, then touchOccured(MotionEvent) and touchOccured(float, float) will always return null. If true, then they will return their expected values

Returns:
the boolean specifying whether this GUIManager should check to see if Buttons are being clicked.

setIsEnabled

public void setIsEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
Set the boolean specifying whether this GUIManager and its buttons are enabled.

Parameters:
isEnabled - The boolean specifying whether this GUIManager is enabled.

initialize

public void initialize(GL10 gl)
Initialize the GUIManager for use.

Parameters:
gl - The GL10 instance used for drawing.

getNumberOfWidgets

public int getNumberOfWidgets()
Get the number of widgets that are being managed by this GUIManager.

Returns:
the number of widgets being managed by this GUIManager.

getWidgets

public IWidget[] getWidgets()
Get the array of widgets in this GUIManager

Returns:
the widgets being managed by this GUIManager

getTappedButton

public Button getTappedButton()
Return the Button that is currently being tapped.

Returns:
the Button that is currently being tapped.

addWidgets

public void addWidgets(IWidget[] widgets)
Add the array of IWidgets to this GUIManager.

Parameters:
widgets - The array of buttons to be managed by this GUIManager

addButton

public boolean addButton(IWidget widget)
Add an IWidget to be managed by this GUIManager. If the GUIManager has already hit its maximum number of buttons it can hold, then it won't add the button and return false.

Parameters:
widget - The widget to be added to, and managed by, this GUIManager
Returns:
false if the widget wasn't added to the GUIManager, true otherwise

buttonIsTapped

public boolean buttonIsTapped()
Return whether the a button in this GUIManager has been tapped.

Returns:
false if a button has not been tapped, true if a button has been tapped.

touchOccured

public Button touchOccured(MotionEvent event)
Convenience method. Does the same thing as touchOccured(float, float) except it uses the MotionEvent instance passed in. Checks the X and Y coordinates of event to see if they fall in to any of the button's space.

Parameters:
event - The MotionEvent that represents the touch
Returns:
the Button that was tapped.

touchOccured

public Button touchOccured(float x,
                           float y)
Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the touch
y - The Y coorindate of the touch
Returns:
the Button that was tapped.

letGoOfButton

public void letGoOfButton()
Tell the GUIManager to notify that the currently tapped Button is no longer being touched.

update

public void update(GL10 gl)

draw

public void draw(GL10 gl)
